reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment you walk into this hotel, you know it's special. Beautifully decorated and spacious with an amazing atrium, the staff are very attentive and polite. Our room was large and had everything we needed. The bar was a bit expensive, but you are getting a waiter service and a pianist, so can't complain. We would definitely return.
reviews.title: Faultless opulence!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading Tripadvisor reviews, we decided to stay at the Corinthia to celebrate my husband's birthday. We followed advice and upgraded to an executive room. The room was fantastic, service excellent, spa beautiful, position of the hotel very good and the ability to access the executive lounge for snacks and drinks resulted in a very special stay. I highly recommend this hotel and will definately go back. Thank you to other tripadvisors for your reviews!
reviews.title: A perfect break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One word of warning though, avoid taxis in Budapest if you can- we were badly ripped off flagging a taxi down on the street. The hotel told us that, unfortunately, this is a common occurance. If you do need a taxi, let the hotel book it for you.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Definitely book an executive room, it is worthwhile for the extras. Make time for the lovely spa facilities too. The hotel is about 20 mins (at the most) from the river and the walk is interesting down a wide boulevard passing the Opera House amongst other buildings.
reviews.title: Beautifully restored hotel with super facilities and interesting history

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple

reviews.title: Stunningly beautiful, supremely comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: A super city break and would recommend a visit to everyone.
reviews.title: STAY HERE - YOU'LL LOVE IT!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed for two nights as and extension to our Amsterdam-Budapest river cruise. What a pity it wasn't a longer stay! This is the most elegant hotel - the foyer, entrance hall, staircase, ballroom and spa are all breathtakingly gorgeous.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One can dine in the covered courtyard, or the inner restaurant, in the bistro, bar or the Rickshaw restaurant (closed at the time of our stay). Excellent food. The breakfast buffet is the most wide-ranging it is possible to imagine, from Hungarian pancakes to eggs Florentine, and just about everything in between. Service throughout the hotel was exemplary.
reviews.title: Birthday treat to remember

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel based on the pictures of the exterior. when i arrived the whole exterior was covered as it's under renovation. i was really bummed out but they upgraded my room to a superior room. overall a nice hotel, clean and modern. they have a beautiful lobby and they are located on the pest side of budapest near 2 metros and close to shops and the jewish quarter.
reviews.title: nice hotel but as of Aug the facade is under rennovation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: I stayed here with my husband, mom-in-law, and sister-in-law for 3 nights. We booked an apartment as that was on offer @ 50% off so well worth it. However, the apartments are in a building built behind the hotel and require a short walk, and 2 elevators. Our apartment was very spacious, however, I was a little bit disappointed in a couple of things. Our bathroom had a tub with a shower on a cable only. So either we had to take a bath or stand up holding this shower in our hands all the time. The 2nd bedroom was very dark, drab, and hot, but their bathroom was fine. They also had a door that opened onto a terrace, but it was fully enclosed and covered, probably so it can be used year round, however, it didn't allow for much natural light and the room had only one small fixture on the ceiling.
reviews.title: Just a great old world European hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself is just stunning, and the staff are all very professional (I think they train hotel staff for other hotels here) and friendly, down to earth, but very helpful. I forgot our converter plug, and when I contacted them, they posted it to me for a nominal cost.
reviews.title: Amazing
Good if you don’t need fresh air

The spa is not as big as the pictures make out but it was very pleasant to use. The hotel lobby is extremely grand, as is the breakfast room. Breakfast consisted of a huge variety of fruit, bread, salami, hot food and many other choices.

Very Grand Hotel in a Great City
reviews.text: Upon arriving at the hotel, we were very pleasantly surprised to find that we were 'guest of the day' and upgraded for free from a 'Superior' room to an 'Executive' room. We shown round, and presented with a complimentary bottle of wine and some fruit. The room itself was pure luxury and faultless. There was a lounge, long hallway with enormous wardrobes, a spotless marble bathroom, and another separate toliet. The bedroom itself was spacious, and had a good view. The bed was the most comfortable I have ever slept in!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple

There is even a chef who will make omlettes to order with whatever filling you would like!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Lucky enough to stay here in October 2009 for nearly a week. We had a 3 bedroomed apartment in the Royal residence complex which offers a huge living area , coupled with full self catering facilities and all you could want for that longer stay. We were met by the hotels assistant manager and shown personally to our apartment. Their waiting for us was a bottle of champagne on ice, swiss chocolates and a welcome card. Things only improved when visiting the stupendous Royal spa and Asian restaurant Ricks. Having stayed in many establishments around the world The Corinthia tops my list of must places to stay , a true gem.
reviews.title: A true 5 star hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay at the Corinthia started out well, as we were upgraded to the Executive floor upon arrival. The staff was very welcoming. The lobby is very nice, border lining on being grand. The room was very large, but dated, and not well maintained. We had a broken chair, some minor plumbing issues, burnt out lights, and both rooms' air conditioning barely worked and one was excessively noisy. Aside from the air conditioning, the minor issues were eventually fixed by the engineering staff. The lounge was reasonably good, though it was spottily stocked- it almost seemed that they hoped to minimize consumption by forcing you to ask the staff for drinks. We had the choice of breakfast in the executive lounge, but it was nowhere near as good as the restaurant- go for the restaurant. The concierge was excellent- very helpful and knowledgeable. Location is about 20-25 minute walk from the river, but is very close to the Oktogon, Andrassy Avenue, and the opera- I was satisfied with where in the city it is located, as I feel we saw more of the city than if we had been on the river. It is also right at a tram stop- we found the tram a very good way to get around the city. If management were to modernize the rooms, this hotel would live up to its potential. Until they do, I can't recommend that this would be the place to stay in Budapest. There are better hotels out there.
reviews.title: Overall, a very good hotel in a good location, but it could use some attention.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 4 nigts in a Junior Suite last month and really loved the Corinthia - everything was great, especially the Executive Club which provided friendly professional service and a good range of food and drinks with very generous evening service times from 5.30 to 9.00 pm ! The hotel is well located and has a good range of restaurants , although we only used the bar. Budapest is a fairly compact city so getting around either on foot or using the superb trasnport network was simple. Liked the Royal spa although found the pool a little chilly for my personal taste. In terms of areas to improve there is very little - like others we found the room far too hot and stuffy and did have to open the big main window all day to keep in cooler. Also the shower pressure and temp did fluctuate annoyingly ( the ones in the spa were fine ) but these are minor niggles - its a great hotel and superb value for money . Even with a large corporate function at the hotel all 4 nights we didnt feel that service slipped.
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My friend and I just returned from our stay at the Corinthia Hotel in Budapest and we both agreed it is an excellent hotel The front staff were very freindly and professional. The concierge could not do enough for the guests. The entire hotel was spotless. We were the guest of the day when we checked in so were upgraded to a suite. It was awesome. Two full bathrooms. Closet space galore. Complimentary bottles of water and a bottle of wine and some fruit. The suite also had a balcony and a seperate sitting room with an additional television. We ate at one of the restaurants and the food was very good as were the wait staff. The breakfast had everything you could want for breakfast and was included in out room price. The bed was very comfortable as well. It also had a turn down service which I have never had before and found so cool. ;) The lobby alone is amazing. The pool was fantastic. We also made use of the sauna and steam shower. As well as the whirlpool. These were all included in the price of the room. You also get bathrobes and slippers to use during your stay. We would not hesitate for a second to recommend this hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in an excellent location

reviews.text: Elegant and grand hotel. Beautiful spa facilities. Room was excellent. Only complaint was it was difficult to shower as there was no curtain in the tub to keep water from spraying everywhere and wifi was horribly slow.

reviews.title: A truly breathtaking luxury hotel

description: First opened in 1896 as the Grand Hotel Royal; a hub for the elite of nineteenth century society, and painstakingly restored to its original glory some hundred years later, the Corinthia Budapest – located in the heart of the city - brings together classic hotel opulence with the finest five-star luxury of modern times. While the gracious frontage, marble floors, sweeping staircase and breathtaking, six-story Atrium preserved from the original building offer glorious hints of a bygone age, the levels of comfort and convenience are all reassuringly up to date.A particular feature is the hotel’s original Royal Spa centre, with 15-metre pool, now extensively refurbished by the current owners to reflect the very best in 21st-century spa luxury while retaining the grandeur of the past. Without doubt the finest hotel in Budapest. Built in classic French Renaissance style, the Grand Royal became a beacon of luxury in the days of Emperor Franz Joseph 1. Designed as a centrepiece of Hungary’s celebrations to mark its first thousand years, the hotel’s grand-style architecture and unrivaled guest facilities were seen as state-of the art for the times. Much of the building was destroyed in the 1956 Hungarian Revolution and despite re-opening in more modest form in the 1960’s, the Grand Royal remained a shadow of its former self until the 1990’s; when new owners Corinthia Hotels gave the green light for an extensive restoration project that would retain the best of the old, while sensitively adding the new. Once restored to its original splendour, the newly named Corinthia Hotel Budapest re-opened its doors, as a five-star luxury property, in 2003.
